The TRANSFORM plugin will make its contents available to the Python script via the 'params' dictionary, with values already converted to native Python types.     - **CRITICAL for TRANSFORM:** The `script` input for `TRANSFORM` MUST be a `string` that represents executable code (e.g., Python, JavaScript) and MUST be provided.","inputDefinitions":[{"name":"script","required":true,"type":"string","description":"The Python code snippet to execute for transformation. The script should print its result to stdout rather than returning it.","aliases":["code","transform_script","snippet"]},{"name":"script_parameters","required":false,"type":"json","description":"Parameters to be passed to the script. Available as a 'params' variable in the script context. The values within 'params' will already be deserialized Python objects (dictionaries, lists, strings, numbers, booleans). Therefore, the Python script should NOT call json.loads() on these values. If referencing outputs from previous steps, embed them directly. For example, to pass 'metrics' from sourceStep 4: '{\"metrics\": {\"outputName\": \"metrics\", \"sourceStep\": 4}}'. The TRANSFORM plugin will make its contents available to the Python script via the 'params' dictionary, with values already converted to native Python types.","aliases":["params","parameters","args"]}],"outputDefinitions":[{"name":"transform_result","required":true,"type":"string","description":"The output captured from stdout after executing the code snippet. Dict[str, Any] = None):\n        self.inputName = inputName\n        self.value = value\n        self.valueType = valueType\n        self.args = args or {}\n\n\n\n\n\n\nclass PluginOutput:\n    \"\"\"Represents a plugin output result\"\"\"\n    def __init__(self, success: bool, name: str, result_type: str, \n                 result: Any, result_description: str, error: str = None):\n        self.success = success\n        self.name = name\n        self.result_type = result_type\n        self.result = result\n        self.result_description = result_description\n        self.error = error\n    \n    def to_dict(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n        \"\"\"Convert to dictionary for JSON serialization\"\"\"\n        output = {\n            \"success\": self.success,\n            \"name\": self.name,\n            \"resultType\": self.result_type,\n            \"result\": self.result,\n            \"resultDescription\": self.result_description\n        }\n        if self.error:\n            output[\"error\"] = self.error\n        return output\n\n\ndef create_success_output(name: str, result: Any, result_type: str = \"string\", \n                         description: str = \"Plugin executed successfully\") -> PluginOutput:\n    \"\"\"Helper function to create a successful output\"\"\"\n    return PluginOutput(\n        success=True,\n        name=name,\n        result_type=result_type,\n        result=result,\n        result_description=description\n    )\n\n\ndef create_error_output(name: str, error_message: str, \n                       description: str = \"Plugin execution failed\") -> PluginOutput:\n    \"\"\"Helper function to create an error output\"\"\"\n    return PluginOutput(\n        success=False,\n        name=name,\n        result_type=\"error\",\n        result=None,\n        result_description=description,\n        error=error_message\n    )\n\n\ndef get_weather_data(location: str, api_key: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n    \"\"\"\n    Fetch weather data from OpenWeatherMap API\n    \n    Args:\n        location: City name or coordinates\n        api_key: OpenWeatherMap API key\n        \n    Returns:\n        Weather data dictionary\n    \"\"\"\n    base_url = \"http://api.openweathermap.org/data/2.5/weather\"\n    params = {\n        \"q\": location,\n        \"appid\": api_key,\n        \"units\": \"metric\"  # Use Celsius\n    }\n    \n    response = requests.get(base_url, params=params, timeout=10)\n    response.raise_for_status()\n    \n    return response.json()\n\n\ndef format_weather_info(weather_data: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n    \"\"\"\n    Format weather data into a readable structure\n    \n    Args:\n        weather_data: Raw weather data from API\n        \n    Returns:\n        Formatted weather information\n    \"\"\"\n    main = weather_data.get(\"main\", {})\n    weather = weather_data.get(\"weather\", [{}])[0]\n    wind = weather_data.get(\"wind\", {})\n    \n    return {\n        \"location\": weather_data.get(\"name\", \"Unknown\"),\n        \"country\": weather_data.get(\"sys\", {}).get(\"country\", \"\"),\n        \"temperature\": main.get(\"temp\"),\n        \"feels_like\": main.get(\"feels_like\"),\n        \"humidity\": main.get(\"humidity\"),\n        \"pressure\": main.get(\"pressure\"),\n        \"description\": weather.get(\"description\", weather_data.get(\"visibility\"),\n        \"timestamp\": weather_data.get(\"dt\")\n    }\n\n\ndef execute_plugin(inputs: Dict[str, InputValue]) -> List[PluginOutput]:\n    \"\"\"\n    Main plugin execution function for WEATHER plugin\n    \n    Args:\n        inputs: Dictionary of input parameters\n        \n    Returns:\n        List of PluginOutput objects\n    \"\"\"\n    try:\n        # Get location input\n        location_input = inputs.get('location')\n        if not location_input:\n            return [create_error_output(\"error\", \"Missing required input: location\")]\n        \n        location = location_input.value\n        if not location or not isinstance(location, str):\n            return [create_error_output(\"error\", \"Location must be a non-empty string\")]\n Set OPENWEATHER_API_KEY environment variable or provide api_key input\")]\n        \n        # Fetch weather data\n        weather_data = get_weather_data(location, api_key)\n        \n        # {item}\")\n\n        # Convert to InputValue objects for compatibility\n        inputs = {}\n        for key, raw_value in inputs_map.items(): # Use raw_value here\n            # Infer valueType based float)):\n                inferred_value_type = 'number'\n            elif isinstance(raw_value, list):\n                inferred_value_type = 'array'\n            elif isinstance(raw_value, dict):\n for a specified location","explanation":"This plugin uses the OpenWeatherMap API to retrieve current weather conditions, temperature, humidity, and other meteorological data for any city or location worldwide.","inputGuidance":"Inputs for this plugin must include 'location'.","repository":{"type":"github"},"inputDefinitions":[{"name":"location","required":true,"type":"string","description":"City etc."},{"name":"summary","required":true,"type":"string","description":"Human-readable weather summary"}],"language":"python","entryPoint":{"main":"main.py","packageSource":{"type":"local","path":"./","requirements":"requirements.txt"},"files":{"main.py":"#!/usr/bin/env python3\n\"\"\"\nWEATHER Plugin for Stage7\n\nThis plugin fetches current weather information for a specified location\nusing the OpenWeatherMap API.\n\"\"\"\n\nimport sys\nimport json\nimport os\nimport requests\nfrom typing import Dict, List, Any, Optional\n\n\nclass InputValue:\n    \"\"\"Represents a plugin input parameter in the new format\"\"\"\n    def __init__(self, inputName: str, value: Any, valueType: str, args: Dict[str, Any] = None):\n        self.inputName = inputName\n        self.value = value\n        self.valueType = valueType\n        self.args = args or {}\n\n\n\n\n\n\nclass PluginOutput:\n    \"\"\"Represents a plugin output result\"\"\"\n    def __init__(self, success: bool, name: str, result_type: str, \n                 result: Any, result_description: str, error: str = None):\n        self.success = success\n        self.name = name\n        self.result_type = result_type\n        self.result = result\n        self.result_description = result_description\n        self.error = error\n    \n    def to_dict(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n        \"\"\"Convert to dictionary for JSON serialization\"\"\"\n        output = {\n            \"success\": self.success,\n            \"name\": self.name,\n            \"resultType\": self.result_type,\n            \"result\": self.result,\n            \"resultDescription\": self.result_description\n        }\n        if self.error:\n            output[\"error\"] = self.error\n        return output\n\n\ndef create_success_output(name: str, result: Any, result_type: str = \"string\", \n                         description: str = \"Plugin executed successfully\") -> PluginOutput:\n    \"\"\"Helper function to create a successful output\"\"\"\n    return PluginOutput(\n        success=True,\n        name=name,\n        result_type=result_type,\n        result=result,\n        result_description=description\n    )\n\n\ndef create_error_output(name: str, error_message: str, \n                       description: str = \"Plugin execution failed\") -> PluginOutput:\n    \"\"\"Helper function to create an error output\"\"\"\n    return PluginOutput(\n        success=False,\n        name=name,\n        result_type=\"error\",\n        result=None,\n        result_description=description,\n        error=error_message\n    )\n\n\ndef get_weather_data(location: str, api_key: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n    \"\"\"\n    Fetch weather data from OpenWeatherMap API\n    \n    Args:\n        location: City name or coordinates\n        api_key: OpenWeatherMap API key\n        \n    Returns:\n        Weather data dictionary\n    \"\"\"\n    base_url = \"http://api.openweathermap.org/data/2.5/weather\"\n    params = {\n        \"q\": location,\n        \"appid\": api_key,\n        \"units\": \"metric\"  # Use Celsius\n    }\n    \n    response = requests.get(base_url, params=params, timeout=10)\n    response.raise_for_status()\n    \n    return response.json()\n\n\ndef format_weather_info(weather_data: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n    \"\"\"\n    Format weather data into a readable structure\n    \n    Args:\n        weather_data: Raw weather data from API\n        \n    Returns:\n        Formatted weather information\n    \"\"\"\n    main = weather_data.get(\"main\", {})\n    weather = weather_data.get(\"weather\", [{}])[0]\n    wind = weather_data.get(\"wind\", {})\n    \n    return {\n        \"location\": weather_data.get(\"name\", \"Unknown\"),\n        \"country\": weather_data.get(\"sys\", {}).get(\"country\", \"\"),\n        \"temperature\": main.get(\"temp\"),\n        \"feels_like\": main.get(\"feels_like\"),\n        \"humidity\": main.get(\"humidity\"),\n        \"pressure\": main.get(\"pressure\"),\n        \"description\": weather.get(\"description\", 2025-11-10T18:23:11.951929423Z \"\").title(),\n        \"main_condition\": weather.get(\"main\", \"\"),\n        \"wind_speed\": wind.get(\"speed\"),\n        \"wind_direction\": wind.get(\"deg\"),\n        \"visibility\": weather_data.get(\"visibility\"),\n        \"timestamp\": weather_data.get(\"dt\")\n    }\n\n\ndef execute_plugin(inputs: Dict[str, InputValue]) -> List[PluginOutput]:\n    \"\"\"\n    Main plugin execution function for WEATHER plugin\n    \n    Args:\n        inputs: Dictionary of input parameters\n        \n    Returns:\n        List of PluginOutput objects\n    \"\"\"\n    try:\n        # Get location input\n        location_input = inputs.get('location')\n        if not location_input:\n            return [create_error_output(\"error\", \"Missing required input: location\")]\n        \n        location = location_input.value\n        if not location or not isinstance(location, str):\n            return [create_error_output(\"error\", \"Location must be a non-empty string\")]\n        \n        # Get API key from environment or input\n        api_key = os.environ.get('OPENWEATHER_API_KEY')\n        api_key_input = inputs.get('api_key')\n        if api_key_input:\n            api_key = api_key_input.value\n        \n        if not api_key:\n            return [create_error_output(\"error\", \n                \"OpenWeatherMap API key required. Set OPENWEATHER_API_KEY environment variable or provide api_key input\")]\n        \n        # Fetch weather data\n        weather_data = get_weather_data(location, api_key)\n        \n        # Format the weather information\n        formatted_weather = format_weather_info(weather_data)\n        \n        # Create summary text\n        summary = (f\"Weather in {formatted_weather['location']}: \"\n                  f\"{formatted_weather['description']}, \"\n                  f\"{formatted_weather['temperature']}C \"\n                  f\"(feels like {formatted_weather['feels_like']}C), \"\n                  f\"Humidity: {formatted_weather['humidity']}%\")\n        \n        # Return results\n        return [\n            create_success_output(\"weather_data\", formatted_weather, \"object\", \n                                 f\"Weather data for {location}\"),\n            create_success_output(\"summary\", summary, \"string\", \n                                 f\"Weather summary for {location}\")\n        ]\n        \n    except requests.exceptions.RequestException as e:\n        return [create_error_output(\"error\", f\"Failed to fetch weather data: {str(e)}\")]\n    except KeyError as e:\n        return [create_error_output(\"error\", f\"Invalid weather data format: {str(e)}\")]\n    except Exception as e:\n        return [create_error_output(\"error\", f\"Unexpected error: {str(e)}\")]\n\n\ndef main():\n    \"\"\"Main entry point for the plugin\"\"\"\n    try:\n        # Read inputs from stdin\n        inputs_str = sys.stdin.read().strip()\n        if not inputs_str:\n            raise ValueError(\"No input provided\")\n\n        # Parse inputs - expecting serialized Map format\n        inputs_list = json.loads(inputs_str)\n        inputs_map = {} # Correctly parse inputs_map\n        for item in inputs_list:\n            if isinstance(item, list) and len(item) == 2:\n                key, val = item\n                inputs_map[key] = val\n            else:\n                logger.warning(f\"Skipping invalid input item: {item}\")\n\n        # Convert to InputValue objects for compatibility\n        inputs = {}\n        for key, raw_value in inputs_map.items(): # Use raw_value here\n            # Infer valueType based on raw_value\n            inferred_value_type = 'string'\n            if isinstance(raw_value, bool):\n                inferred_value_type = 'boolean'\n            elif isinstance(raw_value, (int, float)):\n                inferred_value_type = 'number'\n            elif isinstance(raw_value, list):\n                inferred_value_type = 'array'\n            elif isinstance(raw_value, dict):\n                inferred_value_type = 'object'\n\n            inputs[key] = InputValue(\n                inputName=key, # Assuming inputName is the same as key\n                value=raw_value,\n                valueType=inferred_value_type,\n                args={} # No args provided in the raw input\n            )\n\n        # Execute the plugin\n        outputs = execute_plugin(inputs)\n\n        # Convert outputs to dictionaries and print as JSON\n        output_dicts = [output.to_dict() for output in outputs]\n        print(json.dumps(output_dicts))\n\n    except Exception as e:\n        # Handle any errors in the main execution\n        error_output = create_error_output(\"error\", str(e), \"Plugin execution failed\")\n        print(json.dumps([error_output.to_dict()]))\n\n\nif for a specified location","explanation":"This plugin uses the OpenWeatherMap API to retrieve current weather conditions, temperature, humidity, and other meteorological data for any city or location worldwide.","inputGuidance":"Inputs for this plugin must include 'location'.","repository":{"type":"github"},"inputDefinitions":[{"name":"location","required":true,"type":"string","description":"City name, state/country"},{"name":"api_key","required":false,"type":"string","description":"OpenWeatherMap API key"}],"outputDefinitions":[{"name":"weather_data","required":true,"type":"object","description":"Detailed weather information including temperature, humidity, pressure, wind, etc."},{"name":"summary","required":true,"type":"string","description":"Human-readable weather summary"}],"language":"python","entryPoint":{"main":"main.py","packageSource":{"type":"local","path":"./","requirements":"requirements.txt"},"files":{"main.py":"#!/usr/bin/env python3\n\"\"\"\nWEATHER Plugin for Stage7\n\nThis plugin fetches current weather information for a specified location\nusing the OpenWeatherMap API.\n\"\"\"\n\nimport sys\nimport json\nimport os\nimport requests\nfrom typing import Dict, List, Any, Optional\n\n\nclass InputValue:\n    \"\"\"Represents a plugin input parameter in the new format\"\"\"\n    def __init__(self, inputName: str, value: Any, valueType: str, args: Dict[str, Any] = None):\n        self.inputName = inputName\n        self.value = value\n        self.valueType = valueType\n        self.args = args or {}\n\n\n\n\n\n\nclass PluginOutput:\n    \"\"\"Represents a plugin output result\"\"\"\n    def __init__(self, success: bool, name: str, result_type: str, \n                 result: Any, result_description: str, error: str = None):\n        self.success = success\n        self.name = name\n        self.result_type = result_type\n        self.result = result\n        self.result_description = result_description\n        self.error = error\n    \n    def to_dict(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n        \"\"\"Convert to dictionary for JSON serialization\"\"\"\n        output = {\n            \"success\": self.success,\n            \"name\": self.name,\n            \"resultType\": self.result_type,\n            \"result\": self.result,\n            \"resultDescription\": self.result_description\n        }\n        if self.error:\n            output[\"error\"] = self.error\n        return output\n\n\ndef create_success_output(name: str, result: Any, result_type: str = \"string\", \n                         description: str = \"Plugin executed successfully\") -> PluginOutput:\n    \"\"\"Helper function to create a successful output\"\"\"\n    return PluginOutput(\n        success=True,\n        name=name,\n        result_type=result_type,\n        result=result,\n        result_description=description\n    )\n\n\ndef create_error_output(name: str, error_message: str, \n                       description: str = \"Plugin execution failed\") -> PluginOutput:\n    \"\"\"Helper function to create an error output\"\"\"\n    return PluginOutput(\n        success=False,\n        name=name,\n        result_type=\"error\",\n        result=None,\n        result_description=description,\n        error=error_message\n    )\n\n\ndef get_weather_data(location: str, api_key: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n    \"\"\"\n    Fetch weather data from OpenWeatherMap API\n    \n    Args:\n        location: City name or coordinates\n        api_key: OpenWeatherMap API key\n        \n    Returns:\n        Weather data dictionary\n    \"\"\"\n    base_url = \"http://api.openweathermap.org/data/2.5/weather\"\n    params = {\n        \"q\": location,\n        \"appid\": api_key,\n        \"units\": \"metric\"  # Use Celsius\n    }\n    \n    response = requests.get(base_url, params=params, timeout=10)\n    response.raise_for_status()\n    \n    return response.json()\n\n\ndef format_weather_info(weather_data: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n    \"\"\"\n    Format weather data into a readable structure\n    \n    Args:\n        weather_data: Raw weather data from API\n        \n    Returns:\n        Formatted weather information\n    \"\"\"\n    main = weather_data.get(\"main\", {})\n    weather = weather_data.get(\"weather\", [{}])[0]\n    wind = weather_data.get(\"wind\", {})\n    \n    return {\n        \"location\": weather_data.get(\"name\", \"Unknown\"),\n        \"country\": weather_data.get(\"sys\", {}).get(\"country\", \"\"),\n        \"temperature\": main.get(\"temp\"),\n        \"feels_like\": main.get(\"feels_like\"),\n        \"humidity\": main.get(\"humidity\"),\n        \"pressure\": main.get(\"pressure\"),\n        \"description\": weather.get(\"description\", \"\").title(),\n        \"main_condition\": weather.get(\"main\", \"\"),\n        \"wind_speed\": wind.get(\"speed\"),\n        \"wind_direction\": wind.get(\"deg\"),\n        \"visibility\": weather_data.get(\"visibility\"),\n        \"timestamp\": weather_data.get(\"dt\")\n    }\n\n\ndef execute_plugin(inputs: Dict[str, InputValue]) -> List[PluginOutput]:\n    \"\"\"\n    Main plugin execution function for WEATHER plugin\n    \n    Args:\n        inputs: Dictionary of input parameters\n        \n    Returns:\n        List of PluginOutput objects\n    \"\"\"\n    try:\n        # Get location input\n        location_input = inputs.get('location')\n        if not location_input:\n            return [create_error_output(\"error\", \"Missing required input: location\")]\n        \n        location = location_input.value\n        if not location or not isinstance(location, str):\n            return [create_error_output(\"error\", \"Location must be a non-empty string\")]\n        \n        # Get API key from environment or input\n        api_key = os.environ.get('OPENWEATHER_API_KEY')\n        api_key_input = inputs.get('api_key')\n        if api_key_input:\n            api_key = api_key_input.value\n        \n        if not api_key:\n            return [create_error_output(\"error\", \n                \"OpenWeatherMap API key required. Set OPENWEATHER_API_KEY environment variable or provide api_key input\")]\n        \n        # Fetch weather data\n        weather_data = get_weather_data(location, api_key)\n        \n        # Format the weather information\n        formatted_weather = format_weather_info(weather_data)\n        \n        # Create summary text\n        summary = (f\"Weather in {formatted_weather['location']}: \"\n                  f\"{formatted_weather['description']}, \"\n                  f\"{formatted_weather['temperature']}C \"\n                  f\"(feels like {formatted_weather['feels_like']}C), \"\n                  f\"Humidity: {formatted_weather['humidity']}%\")\n        \n        # Return results\n        return [\n            create_success_output(\"weather_data\", formatted_weather, \"object\", \n                                 f\"Weather data for {location}\"),\n            create_success_output(\"summary\", summary, \"string\", \n                                 f\"Weather summary for {location}\")\n        ]\n        \n    except requests.exceptions.RequestException as e:\n        return [create_error_output(\"error\", f\"Failed to fetch weather data: {str(e)}\")]\n    except KeyError as e:\n        return [create_error_output(\"error\", f\"Invalid weather data format: {str(e)}\")]\n    except Exception as e:\n        return [create_error_output(\"error\", f\"Unexpected error: {str(e)}\")]\n\n\ndef main():\n    \"\"\"Main entry point for the plugin\"\"\"\n    try:\n        # Read inputs from stdin\n        inputs_str = sys.stdin.read().strip()\n        if not inputs_str:\n            raise ValueError(\"No input provided\")\n\n        # Parse inputs - expecting serialized Map format\n        inputs_list = json.loads(inputs_str)\n        inputs_map = {} # Correctly parse inputs_map\n        for item in inputs_list:\n            if isinstance(item, list) and len(item) == 2:\n                key, val = item\n                inputs_map[key] = val\n            else:\n                logger.warning(f\"Skipping invalid input item: {item}\")\n\n        # Convert to InputValue objects for compatibility\n        inputs = {}\n        for key, raw_value in inputs_map.items(): # Use raw_value here\n            # Infer valueType based on raw_value\n            inferred_value_type = 'string'\n            if isinstance(raw_value, bool):\n                inferred_value_type = 'boolean'\n            elif isinstance(raw_value, (int, float)):\n                inferred_value_type = 'number'\n            elif isinstance(raw_value, list):\n                inferred_value_type = 'array'\n            elif isinstance(raw_value, dict):\n                inferred_value_type = 'object'\n\n            inputs[key] = InputValue(\n                inputName=key, # Assuming inputName is the same as key\n                value=raw_value,\n                valueType=inferred_value_type,\n                args={} # No args provided in the raw input\n            )\n\n        # Execute the plugin\n        outputs = execute_plugin(inputs)\n\n        # Convert outputs to dictionaries and print as JSON\n        output_dicts = [output.to_dict() for output in outputs]\n        print(json.dumps(output_dicts))\n\n    except Exception as e:\n        # Handle any errors in the main execution\n        error_output = create_error_output(\"error\", str(e), \"Plugin execution failed\")\n        print(json.dumps([error_output.to_dict()]))\n\n\nif Dict[str, Any] = None):\n        self.inputName = inputName\n        self.value = value\n        self.valueType = valueType\n        self.args = args or {}\n\n\n\n\n\n\nclass PluginOutput:\n    \"\"\"Represents a plugin output result\"\"\"\n    def __init__(self, success: bool, name: str, result_type: str, \n                 result: Any, result_description: str, error: str = None):\n        self.success = success\n        self.name = name\n        self.result_type = result_type\n        self.result = result\n        self.result_description = result_description\n        self.error = error\n    \n    def to_dict(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n        \"\"\"Convert to dictionary for JSON serialization\"\"\"\n        output = {\n            \"success\": self.success,\n            \"name\": self.name,\n            \"resultType\": self.result_type,\n            \"result\": self.result,\n            \"resultDescription\": self.result_description\n        }\n        if self.error:\n            output[\"error\"] = self.error\n        return output\n\n\ndef create_success_output(name: str, result: Any, result_type: str = \"string\", \n name=name,\n        result_type=result_type,\n        result=result,\n        result_description=description\n    )\n\n\ndef create_error_output(name: str, error_message: str, \n                       description: str = \"Plugin execution failed\") -> PluginOutput:\n    \"\"\"Helper function to create an error output\"\"\"\n    return PluginOutput(\n        success=False,\n        name=name,\n        result_type=\"error\",\n        result=None,\n        result_description=description,\n        error=error_message\n    )\n\n\ndef get_weather_data(location: str, api_key: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n    \"\"\"\n    Fetch weather data from OpenWeatherMap API\n    \n    Args:\n        location: City name or coordinates\n        api_key: OpenWeatherMap API key\n        \n    Returns:\n        Weather data dictionary\n    \"\"\"\n    base_url = \"http://api.openweathermap.org/data/2.5/weather\"\n    params = {\n        \"q\": location,\n        \"appid\": api_key,\n        \"units\": \"metric\"  # Use Celsius\n    }\n    \n    response = requests.get(base_url, params=params, timeout=10)\n    response.raise_for_status()\n    \n    return response.json()\n\n\ndef format_weather_info(weather_data: Formatted weather information\n    \"\"\"\n    main = weather_data.get(\"main\", {})\n    weather = weather_data.get(\"weather\", [{}])[0]\n    wind = weather_data.get(\"wind\", {})\n    \n    return {\n        \"location\": weather_data.get(\"name\", \"Unknown\"),\n        \"country\": weather_data.get(\"sys\", {}).get(\"country\", \"\"),\n        \"temperature\": main.get(\"temp\"),\n {formatted_weather['location']}: \"\n                  f\"{formatted_weather['description']}, \"\n                  f\"{formatted_weather['temperature']}C \"\n                  f\"(feels like format\n        inputs_list = json.loads(inputs_str)\n        inputs_map = {} # Correctly parse inputs_map\n        for item in inputs_list:\n            if isinstance(item, list) and len(item) == 2:\n                key, val = item\n                inputs_map[key] = val\n            else:\n                logger.warning(f\"Skipping invalid input item: {item}\")\n\n        # Convert to InputValue objects for compatibility\n        inputs = {}\n        for key, raw_value in inputs_map.items(): # Use raw_value here\n            # Infer valueType based on raw_value\n            inferred_value_type = 'string'\n            if isinstance(raw_value, bool):\n                inferred_value_type = 'boolean'\n            elif isinstance(raw_value, (int, float)):\n                inferred_value_type = 'number'\n            elif isinstance(raw_value, list):\n                inferred_value_type = 'array'\n            elif isinstance(raw_value, dict):\n                inferred_value_type = 'object'\n\n            inputs[key] = InputValue(\n                inputName=key, # Assuming inputName is the same as key\n                value=raw_value,\n                valueType=inferred_value_type,\n                args={} # No args provided in the raw input\n            )\n\n        # Execute the plugin\n        outputs = execute_plugin(inputs)\n\n        #
